Amidst this neverending impasse, a lone youth is saved from the ruins of his devastated world––Tendou Setsuna, a man denied human treatment since birth.

Joining his savior, Lilith––known as the Witch of the Night, he begins his journey across Tokyo Babel...

...yearning for an answer to a single question: Why he still possesses the will to keep on living.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196867.name: Avoider
196867.description:
Ready for a challenge! Your goal in AVOIDER is to travel through the galaxy without taking any damage by enemy ships. Use the Wii U™ GamePad touch screen to navigate, and then post your high score on Miiverse™ for all to see. How high of a score will you get?

Source: The Publisher Website.

196868.name: Tabletop Gallery
196868.description:
Get ready to roll the dice in TABLETOP GALLERY. In this exciting title, you can choose from three games. POKER DICE SOLITAIRE FUTURE combines the single-player experience of Solitaire with the hand building mechanic of Poker. SHUT THE BOX tests your skills at eliminating the tiles on the game board to 'shut the box'. TOSS N GO pits you up against the computer or a second player to see who can be the first one to bank 100 or more points.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196869.name: The Hurricane of the Varstray -Collateral hazard-
196869.description:
User Summary

Defend the Earth against the invasion of mystery mechanical structures.

196870.name: Maximum Override
196870.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Maximum Override is a chaotic city destruction game where the machines come alive.

196871.name: IWO: Bloodbath in the Bonins
196871.description:
Iwo Jima was a critical point on the flight path of US bombers from their Saipan bases to their Japanese targets. The island would be a refuge for malfunctioning or damaged bombers coming or going. An obvious target for a US amphibious assault, the Japanese had reinforced the garrison and dug miles of tunnels the length and breadth of the island. Their goal was to inflict maximum casualties on the Americans to force them to reconsider the seemingly inevitable invasion of Japan. The resulting battle was brutal, even by the standards of the Pacific War.

Key Features:

Expansive campaign spanning the battle of Iwo Jima from 19th Feb to 22nd Mar 1945.
Digital re-imagining of a classic strategy board-game.
Re-create the military strategy utilised by US forces on Iwo Jima.
In-depth tutorial and in-game tips.
Large Hex-based campaign map which encompasses the entire island of Iwo Jima.
Weather system with direct implications on gameplay.
Comprehensive information database covering key aspects of the invasion of Iwo Jima.
Accurately re-created 3D models of the tanks, planes, battleships and bunkers involved in the WWII conflict.
Adjustable zoom allowing classic board game mode with digitally recreated counters, or get close into the action with detailed 3D models.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196872.description: These are 100 metal coins in denominations of 1's and 5's to replace the plastic coins for the game of Brass. These are available separately or contained within the Eagle-Gryphon Games Deluxe Edition.
196872.name: Brass: Metal Coins

196873.name: Tiki Island
196873.description:
From the publisher:

There it is...the smoke bellowing from the mountain peak. It's been rumored for the last two generations. Lucky you. With a great BOOM the top of the mountain is gone and a brilliant red cloud of destruction has filled the void. There's no time to waste! Grab your Tiki, grab your four....err....three...oh no...TWO closest friends and get as far away as possible! You've heard rumor of another island, rich in abundance, on the edge of the horizon. Head to the sea and cross the ocean to find your new home.

Tiki Island is best described as a light strategy game with some...interesting elements thrown in. The goal is simple; get from one side of the ocean to the other. The only problem is that everyone else is trying to do the same, and the vast ocean is only so big.

Use your magical Tiki to build an island chain from one side of the map to the other. Try to avoid the other players, because along with the ability to build new islands, Tikis can hurl powerful runes and utilize devastating combinations to keep you from reaching your goal. Are you going to try for the tortoise or the hare approach? A complete path makes a world of difference...but then again, so does a well timed lightning bolt!

Using simple and intuitive strategy, Tiki Island was designed from the ground up to be a family experience.

196874.name: Civil War: Pea Ridge
196874.description:
Pea Ridge is based on the board game of the same name and is part of the ‘Great Battles of the American Civil War’ series of games, recreating the significant battles of the American Civil War.

The battle of Pea Ridge took place on 7th March, 1862. Over two days, the Confederate forces of Major General Earl Van Dorn were defeated by the Union forces under General Samuel R. Curtis. It was the decisive battle of the trans-Mississippi region, the Union victory assuring Missouri would stay in the Union and that the Union army would dominate the area in the years to come.

Key Features:

Historically accurate game play.
Accurate Civil War units.
Play as either the Union or Confederate side.
3 levels of difficulty.
Five categories of unit quality.
Different types of formations.
Detailed combat analysis.
In-depth reference charts.

Advanced tactical features including:
Map zoom.
Strategic movement.
Flank attacks.
Low ammo.
Unit disruption.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196875.name: Civil War: Wilson's Creek
196875.description:
Wilson’s Creek is based on the board game of the same name and is part of the ‘Great Battles of the American Civil War’ series of games, recreating the significant battles of the American Civil War. The battle of Wilson’s Creek was fought on August 10th, 1861 and took place five miles Southwest of Springfield, Missouri. Brigadier General Nathaniel Lyon led a surprise Union attack upon an allied force of Confederate regulars led by Brigadier General Benjamin McCulloch, and Missouri State Guards led by Major General Sterling Price. The battle was the first major conflict in the Western Theatre, and one of the pivotal factors that kept Missouri in the Union.

Key Features:

Historically accurate game play.
Accurate Civil War units.
Play as either the Union or Confederate side.
3 levels of difficulty.
Five categories of unit quality.
Different types of formations.
Detailed combat analysis.
In-depth reference charts.

Advanced tactical features including:
Map zoom.
Strategic movement.
Flank attacks.
Low ammo.
Unit disruption.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196876.name: Tank Battle: Pacific
196876.description:
Ask most historical strategy gamers about World War Two and not many would have thought there were any tank battles in the Pacific Theatre of World War Two. They did happen, and they happened often, but they never matched the scale of the Western Theatre. Starting in China in the 1930’s the Chinese engaged the Japanese using Russian T26’s and German Panzer I’s. The Japanese fought the Russians in 1939 and 1945, the Soviets with the one of the world’s greatest generals, Zhukov, in command! In 1941 the French in Vietnam briefly fought the Japanese with World War One era tanks. In Burma and India, British Commonwealth forces regularly engaged in battle using equipment that would have been considered obsolete on the West Front. Finally the titanic struggle between the Japanese and United States of American resulted in dozens of tank engagements. Even the Island War battles saw some engagements with over 30 Japanese tanks in a single mass assault. Tank Battle: Pacific attempts to create many of these battles with a mixture of historical battles and themed scenarios that capture the experience of being a tank commander in the Pacific Theatre in World War Two. Fight battles between Japan, France, China, Russia, British Commonwealth and The United States of America. The game has a wide range of features from the tank battles of Northern Manchuria to the battlefields of Burma and the landings on the Pacific Islands. The game even includes a what-if scenario for Operation Olympic, the invasion of the Japanese homelands. The game system is a major upgrade of the already successful Tank Battle game engine from HexWar.

Key Game Features:

High Definition World War II era graphics.
15 Missions to play through, including 2 large-scale beach invasions.
Play as the Japanese in the 8 Mission ‘First Strike’ tutorial campaign, concluding with a full-scale mission.
Play as the Chinese versus the Japanese in the ‘Bonus’ Campaign (1 Mission).
Play as the Japanese versus the French, then Chinese, the Americans in the 3 Mission ‘Rising Sun’ Campaign.
Play as the Americans versus the Japanese in the 3 Mission ‘Eclipse’ Campaign.
Over 123 unique units!
Specialist units such as LV’Ts (Landing Craft Tank), LVCP’s (Landing Craft), Engineers and the ubiquitous LVT (Landing Vehicle Tracked)
Japanese bunkers and other fortifications.
Japanese Infiltration units.
Japanese ‘Nikuhaku’ anti-tank suicide units.
High Definition grassland and beach terrains.
Four troop classes; Raw, Average, Veteran and Elite.
Other Game Features; detailed combat analysis, flank attacks, strategic movement, indirect fire, mounting and dismounting from vehicles, multi-level hills and minesweepers.
Hours of game play.
Map zoom.

Purchasable Extra Content:
Play as the Japanese versus the British Commonwealth in a 5 mission ‘Empire’ campaign.
Play as the British Commonwealth versus the Japanese in a 5 mission ‘Commonwealth’ campaign.
Play as the Soviet Union versus the Japanese in a 5 mission ‘Red Bear’ campaign.

Note: The purchasable extra content is already included in the Mac edition of the game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196878.name: A Disturbed Breakfast
196878.description:
From the introduction:

Breakfast is disturbed by a half-dead farmer. Can the players stop this threat?

A 1 to 2 - hour adventure for 1st level characters.

196879.name: Brewing in Faerûn
196879.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement explores brewing practices and select beers of the Forgotten Realms. It is divided into four parts listed below. The first section explores methods exercised by the finest brewers of the realms. Often this knowledge is secretive, and very rarely taught. Next is a spotlight of unique ales favored in various corners of Faerûn to add life to new taverns and towns that are explored.

196880.name: Cave of the Missing
196880.description:
People go in but never come out

From the introduction:

A small village named Skirl Village located where a sparse forest meets a cliff face is the home of around 20 people. Two of these people were betrothed to each other. Ameriel the bride and Pirith the bridegroom. The couple seems happy and are looking forward to their marriage. The ritual of marriage in the village is preceded the day before by the bride walking the forest contemplating her life and making sure she wants to marry. The bridegroom drinks at the only inn in town, "The Absent Priest", with the bride's father, and tries to convince him that he’ll do right by his daughter.

A five to six hour adventure adjustable for one to six 1st-3rd level characters.

196881.name: Enter the Shadowfell
196881.description:
From the introduction:

Your characters are now in the Shadowfell. They will quickly learn They will need to join others in order to survive. But will they decide to leave the Shadowfell before it corrupts them (if not kill them), or will they accept it and make those who are under them suffer?

Adventure for 2th-5th level characters.

196882.name: Environmental Protection
196882.description:
From the introduction:

A local coven of druids claims that a mining town is disrupting the balance of nature in the area, and are trying to move the entire town away from the area – by any means necessary.

A short adventure for 3rd level characters.

196883.name: Orcs Invade Phandalin
196883.description:
From the introduction:

The Ghost Tribe of Orcs have been driven from their home under Wyvern Tor by some terrible evil and have traveled to the top of the hill overlooking Phandalin where they camped last night. Their chief, driven mad by unknown horrors, prepares to attack the city and claim it as his new home. The heroes, who raced to the town ahead of the orc tribe, spend the night helping to prepare defenses and rest when they can.

Can the heroes help defend the town or will the orcs wipe out the inhabitants of Phandalin?

A 2-4 hour adventure for 5th-6th level characters.

User summary:

Requires the use of the Unearthed Arcana "Mass Combat" optional rules.

196884.name: Orcs to Phandalin
196884.description:
From the introduction:

The Ghost Tribe of Orcs have been driven from their home under the Sword Mountains by some terrible evil and they now see Phandalin as their best option for a new home. The heroes, who are on their way to Phandalin for a much needed rest after their adventures in the Lost Mine, must make it to town in time to warn the inhabitants and help prepare for the orc attack.

A 2-5 hour adventure for 5th-6th level characters.

196885.name: Against the Orcs
196885.description:
From the introduction:

The orc uprising around Nirzumbil must come to an end! The Mercur trade coster is benefiting too much from the blockade of the dwarven stronghold and threatens to corner the market on iron ore and gems for years to come. If the orc warlord commanding the armies can be slain, the orc forces will surely fall apart. But how to find and kill a warlord who is powerful enough to unite thousands of orcs?

A multi-session adventure for four or five 6th level characters

196886.name: Let it Be
196886.description:
From the introduction:

It would take a lot to force the PCs to ally with the very orcs that have been causing them so much trouble recently. But what have those damnable orcs stirred up in the abandoned copper mines?

A four-hour adventure for 4th level characters

196887.name: Strike Back
196887.description:
From the introduction:

An orcish emissary is travelling the lands south of the dwarven stronghold of Nirzumbil, attempting to keep the tribes in line and focused upon harassing the dwarves. If the PCs can defeat the emissary before he can complete his rounds, they might be able to splinter a part of the orcish alliance.

An adventure for 4th level characters

196888.name: The Horns of War
196888.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs have escorted a trade caravan to the dwarven stronghold of Nirzambil and are preparing for a boring trip home. But what is that sound of horns in the distance? And why are the dwarves closing the front gates to the mines?

An adventure for 2nd level characters

196889.name: Ascension
196889.description:
From the introduction:

Mono, a lich, has almost succeeded in killing all of the members of the God's Bane. Primrose has been in search of Mono and her phylactery. The party is contacted again and again their assistance is requested. If they fail the world will be in trouble.

Adventure for 19th-20th level characters

196890.name: The Tomb of Nim-Aer
196890.description:
From the introduction:

The God's Bane is a group of adventurers that are known for fighting deity-level creatures. One of the members (Nim-Aer) has heard word of some individuals that could become the next group to defend the world in trouble. Nim-Aer invites them to meet him and go through a tomb he made. But something in the tomb is killing him and preventing him from stopping it himself...

Adventure for 13th level-15th level characters

196891.name: White Plume Mountain
196891.description:
From the introduction:

In 1979, TSR published the module named White Plume Mountain with the module code S2. It was written by Lawence Schick with interior art by Erik Otus and David C. Sutherland III. Jeff Dee illustrated the full-color cover for the 1981 publishing. This 16-page booklet had an outer folder containing maps. The adventure contained within has been enjoyed by players and DM’s for nearly 4 decades. In 2004, for the 30th anniversary of the Dungeons & Dragons game, Dungeon magazine ranked this module the 9th greatest adventure of all time. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

196892.name: The Keep on the Borderlands
196892.description:
From the introduction:

An introductory adventure written by the late Gary Gygax with many features to aid novice players and Dungeon Masters. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

An adventure location for 1st– 3rd level characters which also includes an intended starting place for first time Dungeon Masters and their first ever campaign setting.

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

196893.name: Palace of the Silver Princess
196893.description:
From the introduction:

Palace of the Silver Princess is notable as being the D&D module recalled on the same day it was released, then rewritten and re-released some months later. The original version, with the orange cover, was written in 1980 by Jean Wells. When the orange version was recalled (and most copies destroyed), the module was rewritten by Tom Moldvay and released with a green cover. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original orange-colored module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

An adventure location for 1st– 3rd level characters which also includes a sketched out sandbox setting.

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

196894.name: Ravenloft
196894.description:
From the introduction:

In 1983, TSR published the module named Ravenloft with the module code I6. It was written by Tracy and Laura Hickman and illustrated by Clyde Caldwell. This 32-page booklet had two outer folders containing maps by David Sutherland III. It spawned a 1986 sequel, I10 Ravenloft II: The House on Gryphon Hill; together, they formed the basis of AD&D 2nd Edition's Ravenloft campaign setting. In 2004, for the 30th anniversary of the Dungeons & Dragons game, Dungeon magazine ranked this module the 2nd greatest adventure of all time. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

A 20+ hour adventure for 5th– 7th level characters

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

196895.name: Castle Amber

rpgissuearticle.12840: The 30 Greatest D&D Adventures of All Time

196895.description:
From the introduction:

In 1981, TSR published the module named Castle Amber with the module code X2. It was written by Tom Moldvay and illustrated by Jim Holloway, Harry Quinn, Jim Roslof, Stephen D. Sullivan, and Erol Otus. This 32-page booklet had an outer folder containing a map of the castle. An AD&d 2nd Edition boxed set sequel adventure, Mark of Amber, was released for the Mystara line in 1995. In 2004, for the 30th anniversary of the Dungeons & Dragons game, Dungeon magazine ranked this module the 15th greatest adventure of all time. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

A 20+ hour adventure for 3rd–6th level characters

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

196896.name: The Lost City
196896.description:
From the introduction:

In 1982, TSR published the module named The Lost City with the module code B4. It was written by Tom Moldvay and illustrated by Jim Holloway. This 32-page booklet had an outer folder containing maps. In addition to an extensive dungeon complex, the module provided guidance on expanding and creating additional levels and encounters for the adventure. In 2004, for the 30th anniversary of the Dungeons & Dragons game, Dungeon magazine ranked this module the 28th greatest adventure of all time. This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

A 20+ hour adventure for 1st– 3rd level characters

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

This item usually is distributed in a ZIP archive containing both the PDF version and the Libre Office version.

196897.name: Forgotten Realms 5000
196897.description:
From the introduction:

The Forgotten Realms... in the year 5000!

A global apocalypse has left the world unrecognizable. Magic is all but forgotten and science reigns supreme. The Torillian Federation stretches over a thousand planets, united by their resistance to the all-consuming Illithid Collective. The homeworld itself is half megapolis, and half radioactive wasteland.

Prepare for adventure beyond anything you have seen before...

User summary:

Includes an introductory adventure for a session of 3-4 hours, entitled "Welcome to the Future".

196898.name: PROJECT
196898.description:
Publisher's blurb:

PROJECT is a role-playing game about heroic guardians of reality.

After a terrible, supernatural disaster the world has been rent asunder and strange things have begun to bleed in all around the edges.

Humanity has recovered to an extent and continues to fight these beings and forces from beyond known as ‘Entities’.

The group PROJECT is at the forefront of humanity’s defence, using the strange technologies and abilities of the Entities against them and reasserting reality one bloody fight at a time.

In the game you will take the role of one of the heroic agents of PROJECT, modified
through barely understood technology and thrown against the strange and deadly beings and events that press in on the Earth from its neighbouring dimensions and parallels. In the process you may begin to discover things that you wish you didn’t know and that the battle for reality is not as black and white as you have
been indoctrinated to think.

PROJECT IS SAVIOUR

PROJECT uses the Open D6 system and can be customised to play at street, investigative, conspiracy or action levels.

196899.name: Happy Easter
196899.description:
From the introduction:

In this book we have new magic items and monsters for a silly Easter themed dungeon. This was a little project of ours to celebrate Easter. Have fun and enjoy! We hope to be delivering many more works in the future so stay posted and select to follow our submissions. Believe me you wont want to miss anything. Happy Easter!

196900.name: The Crumbling Wall
196900.description:
From the introduction:

While traveling through the forest the party hears a hauntingly beautiful melody. Upon investigation, they discover a crumbling wall with a bard perched atop it playing a lute.

The figure stops playing. "Ah travelers, do you know the history of this wall?" he asks in a baritone voice.

User summary:

An introductory scenario for 1st level characters.

196901.name: Verlies
196901.description:
User Summary

Verlies is a text adventure by Imperator with a fantasy theme.

196902.name: A Prince's Death
196902.description:
From the introduction:

How did the prince die?

The leader of an elven tribe in the High Forest is dead. Now the Council of Elders has assembled and are trying to find the heir to the dead elven prince. But how did the elven prince actually die and why can’t the Council of Elders find a living heir?

A 4-6 hour adventure for 11th level characters

196903.name: Above and Below: Friends in High Places
196903.description:
From the introduction:

Haggofik the dwarven prospector has a nose for ore. And he believes he's found a vein of rare metal up in the mountains. The only problem is that this territory is claimed by a tribe of birdmen.

A two-hour adventure for 3rd level characters

196904.name: Duty's Edge
196904.description:
A One v One Adventure

From the introduction:

The Dragonborn of Bal-Ghul are divided among many clans, and the
Order of the Stoneguard is sworn to uphold the laws and ways that unify them. High Warchaplain Kaden orders Ansaar, to find those who abducted Jarl Bloodclaw’s wife bring the thieves to justice and return Lady Bloodclaw to the jarl. Along the way, politics, duty and the very land will test Ansaar’s mettle. If victorious, the hero will uncover the machinations of ancient enemies, and perhaps find a way to thwart their foul designs.

A four hour adventure for one 4th-5th level character

196905.name: Into the Dragon's Den
196905.description:
From the introduction:

Into the Dragon's Den is a Dungeons & Dragons adventure designed for a single session of 4-6 hours play. Although it is set around Longsaddle, it can be moved to any other setting with a small amount of work.

The combat sessions have been designed to present a tough challenge to four 1st level characters. It will present a less difficult, though still enjoyable, challenge to 2nd level characters.

196906.name: Into the Temple of the Yuan-Ti
196906.description:
A hissssterical adventure to challenge your party

From the introduction:

While on the search for a dear friend who went missing in the Serpent Hills, rumors circulate that he has been captured by the Yuan-Ti. Following a trail, your party has been led to an unknown settlement guarded by Yuan-Ti. Are you brave enough to venture deep into its secrets? Are you strong enough to get out alive?

A 5 to 6-hour adventure for four-8th level characters

196907.name: Julinda's Gauntlet
196907.description:
From the introduction:

Julinda the gnome mage has always been a bit off. She is a chronomancer who has become obsessed with achieving the reliable and reproducible technology of time travel, in the interest of returning to select parts of history and influencing their outcome to her pleasing; perhaps to avert a war, or to head off the enslavement of her people, or prevent the death of a loved one. Those who know her were aware of her ambitions, and now worry that they are coming to fruition, as she hasn't been seen in several months. And so, they have implored the PCs to seek her out...

User summary:

The module includes a YouTube link to a Free Video Supplement.

196908.name: Love's Labour Lost
196908.description:
A Tale of True Romance

From the introduction:

The Lady Marinto’s father is embroiled in political turmoil in his home nation. So he spirited his daughter away and the PCs are asked to guard her for a time. But just who, or what, is after her... and why?

A four-hour adventure for 4th level characters set in the Forgotten Realms featuring elements from Oriental Adventures

196909.name: The Yawn
196909.description:
User Summary

The Yawn is a text adventure by Byteriders with a fantasy theme. The game is a parodie of "The Pawn".

196910.name: The Judgement of Bones
196910.description:
Five Tales of Secrets, Sins, and Skeletons

From the introduction:

In Absolution the PCs pursue a wanted criminal to a village where everyone can find forgiveness, for a price. In Devil's Due the PCs must save the soul of a warlock from the devil. A young woman has a rendezvous with death in A Grave For Two. Skeletons take over the land in Kingdom of Bone and in Skeletons In The Closet a bandit's ability to seemingly vanish from pursuers is tied to a terrible secret.

User summary:

Intended for any level of character.

196911.name: The Tower of Tharikthiril
196911.description:
Old Enemies Don't Die

From the introduction:

The evil wizard Tharikthiril was defeated by the dwarves years ago. But why then are the groundlings becoming numerous around his ruined tower? And what are those strange lights seen in the distance coming from the direction of his tower? Has the wizard somehow cheated death and risen again?

A six-hour adventure for 3rd level characters

196912.name: A Taste of Honey
196912.description:
Success is Sweet

From the introduction:

The party has been hired to retrieve some honey from the some bees. Sounds simple right? Too bad these bees are monstrously large!

A four-hour adventure for 3rd level characters

196913.name: Tower by the Sea of Fallen Stars
196913.description:
Intrigue and Battle on the Coast of Impiltur

From the introduction:

After the changes of the Spellplague, aboleths and their servants assail the coasts of the Sea of Fallen Stars. Yet there are those who would defend the land-dwellers against the ancient aberrations. One of these men is Lord Faden. But his tower is in decline and many fear that it will soon fall to the enemy. Unable to prevent this catastrophe, the members of the Grand Council of Impiltur send a group of young heroes to retrieve a magical artifact from within the tower which should not fall into the hands of the enemy. However, Lord Faden is less than happy to part with this powerful item...

A 4-hour adventure for three to five 2nd level characters.

196914.name: A Boy and his Modron
196914.description:
Extra-planar visitors always bring trouble...

From the introduction:

A young boy befriends an extra-planar construct that has mysteriously appeared at his family’s farm. Once the boy finds out that other creatures are coming to take it back home, he comes up with a plan to get help from the party to save his new friend.

Recommended for experienced Dungeon Masters

A 4-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

196915.name: The Curious Expedition
196915.description:
User Summary

In The Curious Expedition the player sets foot into the unknown to be the first of the Guild's explorers to reach the mysterious golden pyramid.

During the adventures the player encounters dangerous beasts, deceitful natives and other unspoken horrors.

196916.name: A Time of Magic and Shadows
196916.description:
User summary:

This sourcebook presents a well-developed villain and his various plans, powers, and connections. It also provides a basic campaign setting that centers on the villain. The intent of the product is to provide an easy-to-use campaign setting that can form the basis of a more completely developed campaign. Several adventure hooks are noted.

The item is atypical because the text is repeated twice - once in English, and once in Portuguese.

196917.name: Mystery at Loudwater
196917.description:
From the introduction:

Loudwater is a small city, located on the confluence of the Delimbiyr and Greyflow rivers. It has seen better days, but parts of its former splendor remain. Even though the population has greatly dwindled, traces of its former splendor remain. But lately, caravans have been banishing without a trace, and people are getting nervous.

A 3-hour standalone adventure for 1st-3rd level characters

196918.name: Commodore 1351
196918.description:
The Commodore 1351 is a mouse made by Commodore in 1986, which can be directly plugged into the 9-pin control port of a Commodore 64 or 128.

Description
The Commodore 1351 is similar in appearance to the mouse supplied with Commodore Amiga computers of the time, but the two are not mutually compatible. In its default mode, it is a true proportional mouse, but by holding down the right mouse button when powering up the machine, it can be made to emulate a joystick.

The mouse was distributed with a user manual containing maintenance instructions, pinouts, and sample BASIC and machine language programs for the Commodore 64 and 128. Also included was a diskette containing diagnostic tools, demos, drivers, and an upgrade for the GEOS operating system

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commodore_1351 Commodore 1351]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

196919.name: In Search of the Unknown: Zelligar's Evil
196919.description:
From the introduction:

Thirty two years ago, Zelligar the Unknown and Rogahn the Fearless led a mercenary army into the Maerthwatch Mountains to crush their hated enemies - the barbaric Orgahn Tribes - never to be heard from again. It is said that a great treasure is hidden somewhere in the depths of their abandoned underground fortress. Do you have what it takes to find it?

A 15-20 hour adventure for 5-7 characters of 1st to 3rd level

User summary:

The item typically is distributed as a ZIP archive including the PDF game document and four PNG files for maps - two keyed maps for the DM and two unkeyed maps for the players. The maps show an upper and lower level of "Quasqueton".

196920.name: Underdark Side Treks
196920.description:
From the introduction:

The winding tunnels of the Underdark are ripe with terrors, and the Out of the Abyss campaign offers many weeks of travel therein...

User summary:

This document presents three "side treks", or minor adventures, intended to be inserted into another scenario at some appropriate point. They are designed for low-level characters.

196921.name: Character Creation through Roleplaying
196921.description:
From the introduction:

The purpose of this module is to introduce a new player, or players, and a Dungeon Master (DM), to the process of creating a Dungeons and Dragons 5th edition character. In this module [each character is built up] through role-playing, storytelling, and the use of targeted questions by the DM. At the end of this module, each player should have a level 1 character that's ready to play.

A 2-hour adventure for "unfinished" characters

196922.name: Fight Club
196922.description:
From the introduction:

The purpose of this module is to introduce a new player, or players, and a Dungeon Master (DM), to the fight mechanics included in the D&D 5E Player's Handbook (PHB). It is assumed that your party consists of four level one characters of a good alignment, and that their character sheets are (mostly) completed. You can adjust the difficulty of the encounters [as needed].

A 2-hour adventure for 1st level characters

196923.name: Wico Boss
196923.description:
User Summary
Joystick from Wico, with gray base and black handle, and white fire button on top.
The handle was (later?) also available in red for Wico's Command Control series, but the Boss controller itself is not a part of the Command Control line.

The rear side is "labeled" The Boss - Precision Engineered

196924.name: Hama Said Knock You Out
196924.description:
From the introduction:

This module is designed to take 2nd level characters up to 3rd level. For most classes, this means picking an archetype, tradition, or oath. Some classes, such as Cleric, pick this at level two and it is okay if the players have already selected their class specialization. At the end of this module, each character will be given the chance to apprentice with a master of their class. As apprentices, they can pick their archetype, tradition, or oath, and it is recommended that players who have already selected this for their character (e.g. Clerics and Druids) be allowed to change it at this point if they so desire.

196925.name: QuickShot I
196925.description:
User Summary
First joystick in the QuickShot series: It had an ergonomically shaped handle with a fire button on top, and a second fire button on the base.

It is said to be the world's first ergonomic joystick.
Developed and patented by Harry Fox and Peter Law in 1982 (U.S. Patent D271220).

Dimensions:
115 x 90 x 165 mm

196926.name: QuickShot II
196926.description:
User Summary
Second generation of the of the ergonomic joystick; This had a bigger handle, and bigger fire button on the top, as well as a trigger button on the front of the handle.. The fire button on the base was removed, but auto-fire switch mode was added.

QuickShot II Plus arrived in 1984, not much seems to have changed apart from new switches.

QuickShot II Turbo came on the marked in 1985; The base was changed a little bit in design, an changed color from black to red plastic (with black "grip wings"); the Auto-fire switch got a third setting, allowing it to be used with Amstrad CPC.
The Turbo was also sold under the Sigma label

196927.name: QuickShot III Joystick Controller
196927.description:
User Summary
Third series of QuickShot joysticks; this one had a numpad as well, designed to be used with the ColecoVision. It could be used on Commodore or Atari as well, but as joystick only (numpad would not be working)

196928.description: The Catan commodities as funny Plush Animals that actually score points when you get them. Similar to longest road, who ever has the most houses adjacent to a resource gets it's plush and with it an extra victory point. Can be used in the base game or with any of the expansions.
196928.name: Catan Scenarios: Catanimals

196929.description:
These finely-minted coins are crafted from zinc and nickel with high-relief 3D detailing and a hand-buffed finish, with a raised-edge lip for easy stacking.

Publisher's note: Due to the quantity of coins in the 7 Wonders game and premium quality of these coins, they are sold as a half-set (30 "one" coins, 17 "three" coins, and 10 "six" coins). For a complete game set of coins, we recommend 2 sets.

Also comes in a set designed to replace the full set of 7 Wonders Duel paper coins - 14 "one" coins, 10 "three" coins, and 7 "six" coins: 7 Wonders Duel: Metal Coins
196929.name: 7 Wonders: Metal Coins

196930.description: SAGA: Age of the Wolf is the SAGA Dark Ages Campaign book. It contains a campaign system for two or more players in which rival Warlords lead their Warbands in a bloody struggle for land, wealth, and reputation. There are many ways to come out on top in the campaign and claim the crown. How you do it will be up to you and the motivations of your Warlord - unless, of course, your opponents have other ideas.
196930.name: Saga: Age of the Wolf

196932.name: Knights of Invasion

rpgseries.26090: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System

196932.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your kingdom is on the brink of war. A tournament has been arranged to celebrate your monarch’s birthday, and envoys from the enemy kingdom will be attending the festivities. As if the situation isn’t stressful enough, strange lights are seen in the sky, and a terrifying alien invasion begins.

Gather your fellow knights to battle with little green men and fire trebuchets on acid-filled insect creatures. Can the rival kingdoms put aside their problems and work together, or will one side use the chaos of the situation to their own advantage? Find out in this Fate World of Adventure by Richard Bellingham.

Knights of Invasion uses Fate Core to play. This 54-page supplement includes:

A unique mix of epic fantasy and science fiction elements.
Options for mini-campaign, one-shot convention, and campaign play, each customized for repeat play.
A toolkit for using knights in Fate, including system elements for retainers, knightly codes, armor and weaponry, and more.
Rules for siege engines and tournament battles.
A simple alien creation system with enough choices to fuel multiple alien races without repeating attributes.




Knights of Invasion.
Follow the code.
Protect your liege.

196933.name: Party Hard

videogamehonor.37587: 2015 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee

196933.description:
It’s 3AM. Your neighbors are having a loud party. Stop them.

Party Hard is a tactical game about stopping parties. Playing as someone who got sick of neighbors having loud parties, you decide to take matters into your own hands with the help of your faithful knife. The story follows a series of mass murders around the USA, with parties taking place in various locations including Las Vegas, Miami, San Francisco, and more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196934.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 89 - Mar 2016)
196934.description:
New Domains of Adventure!

Pick up your sword and get ready for adventure as we take GURPS Dungeon Fantasy into totally different realms! This issue of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - offers up meaty new options for your Dungeon Fantasy (or just plain GURPS fantasy) games. Its supplement-length features include:


"Havens and Hells," a full campaign setting from Dungeon Fantasy architect Sean Punch. Imagine a world where dying in battle is only a setback, where gold isn't the root of all adventure, and where the Gods themselves have a secret that could disrupt the very foundation of reality. Explore the depths of Hell as you bring back supplies and gear for the idyllic Havens that dot the world. This feature offers details on GURPS traits that are most useful, advice on which magic is likely or impossible (regardless of which GURPS magic system you use), and more!
"The Titan's House," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Banestorm: Abydos author David L. Pulver. Take on the massive abode of a titan - who may or may not still be alive and in attendance - and turn the notion of scale on its ear, in an adventure suitable for any Dungeon Fantasy campaign. It supplies stats for seven new Dungeon Fantasy monsters plus maps of the gargantuan two-story home and its dungeon.
"Eastern Adventures," a guide to new realms of adventure from frequent Pyramid contributor Christopher R. Rice in the vein of the martial artist from GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 1: Adventurers and the master of shadows from GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 12: Ninja. Learn how to make distinctly unique adventures that tap into the vein of the "Mysterious East," with information on how to translate existing templates, plus a new samurai lens, new races, power-ups, and more.


This issue also provides a Random Thought Table that puts a twist on the notion of dungeon-crawling, as well as another peek into the new Car Wars universe from Matt Riggsby that shows you five great places to get killed. Dungeon Fantasy is all about exploring the unknown, and that goes doubly for this issue of Pyramid!

- Publisher's description

196935.name: A Grandiose Disaster Core Rules
196935.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the publisher's webpage:

A Grandiose Disaster is a strongly structured character-centric short-form larp. The organizer (who can also play in the game, depending on their comfort level with handling logistics alongside play) chooses or creates a disaster/horror movie scenario. Players use a set of archetypes to create characters and establish relationships before the disaster hits. Once it does, the game turns to a struggle of survival in the face of incredible, deadly odds!

Not every character will die, but some death in inevitable. Players whose characters die still participate in the game, whether by taking on narrator duties, playing side characters, or joining the "peanut gallery" to comment on this grandiose disaster as it unfolds!

196936.name: Reverse Crawl
196936.description:
Reverse Crawl is a turn based dungeon crawl where YOU are the dungeon! Lead your minions in tactical turn-based combat against the pesky heroes, and unlock a variety of evil Powers. With a dynamic campaign system and a branching storyline, “Reverse Crawl” lets you experience an RPG from a whole new angle!

Source: The Developer Website.

196938.description:
The cold, hard realities of life on the frontier can sometimes leave children alone in the world. Growing up fast is the only way to survive, and though many will fail, those Orphans that are wiley and fast enough can not only survive, but thrive, as they grow into the life of a Hero.

The Orphan is a new Hero Class that can be added to your games of Shadows of Brimstone. She is quick and agile, darting between Enemies, and constantly on the move. Though she does not have a lot of Health or Defense, the Orphan can quickly bounce back from damage and has a high tolerance for the horrors found out in the world. Includes Male and Female Orphan miniatures in high-detail resin, two 30mm plastic bases, Orphan Double-Sided Hero Character Sheet, Rulesheet, Orphan Upgrade Chart, Starting Upgrade Cards, Starting Gear, and Orphan Mission Deck.
196938.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Orphan Hero Pack

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196939.description:
Since before Dark Stone was even discovered in the hills around Brimstone, Prospectors were a common sight around town and out on the trails; mining in the hills and panning for gold in the streams and rivers. When the Dark Stone boom hit, their number multiplied... by the hour. Prospectors from all around flooded the area, looking to get in on a piece of the action. Once the town exploded and the portals starting tearing open, most fled in terror. Those that didn’t either had nowhere to go or were too stubborn to let any creatures and demons from some other world steal their claim!

The Prospector is a new Hero Class that can be added to your games of Shadows of Brimstone. He is a strong close combat fighter and can absorb a lot of damage before being KO’d. He also is the best around for collecting up Gold and Dark Stone, as his abilities allow him to earn double the amount found on most occasions. His only real drawbacks are in having low Initiative and not being allowed to use Guns or Tech. Includes Male and Female Prospector miniatures in high-detail resin, two 30mm plastic bases, Prospector Double-Sided Hero Character Sheet, Rulesheet, Prospector Upgrade Chart, Starting Upgrade Cards, and Starting Gear.
196939.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Prospector Hero Pack

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

rpgitemversion.306413: Deck PDF - Tarot sized - Fool's Challenge Edition

196940.name: þe Specter
196940.description:
Author summary
þe Specter is a deck-based storygame for zero human players and two to five ghosts.

It was a submission to the 2016 Fool's Challenge contest.

196941.description:
Not all creatures that stalk the canyons and mines around Brimstone are from an OtherWorld. When the resonating horde of Dark Stone blew Brimstone off the map, it released waves of Void energy across the land, tainting the earth and mutating man and beast alike! The Dark Stone Hydra is one such creation; a common rattlesnake, found throughout the deserts of the Southwest, grown massive by the twisting powers of the Dark Stone! With multiple hissing heads, spiked Dark Stone shards protruding from its body, and a brutal Dark Stone rattle, these savage beasts are a terror beyond imagining, made all the more frightening by their common appearance throughout the region.

The Dark Stone Hydra is a gigantic and terrifying beast! It is not only massive, but also fast and deadly as it strikes, slithering between models to change targets and snapping with all of its fanged heads! The Dark Stone Radiation that taints this creature also exudes from its body, corrupting those that stray too close, and its ability to regenerate damage offsets the fact that it loses power as you cut off its heads. This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add the savagely giant Dark Stone Hydra to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! A high detail plastic model of the Dark Stone Hydra is included, as well as the rules and cards needed to add it to your games.

CONTENTS
1x Rulesheet
1x Dark Stone Hydra model
1x Large Enemy Record Sheet
2x 1 Dark Stone Hydra (Threat: Low) cards
2x 1 Dark Stone Hydra (Threat: Medium) cards
2x 1 Dark Stone Hydra (Threat: High) cards
196941.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Hydra XL Enemy Pack

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196942.description:
Ancient caretakers from the Targa Plateau, these large, spider-like Robots roam the halls and chambers of the ancient, alien city, maintaining the systems

and repairing damage done by intruders and the rigors of time. On occasion these machines will stray through a portal, and begin terraforming whatever world they end up in, building new pylons and converting the local area into a remote extension of Targa, itself.

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add the robotic Custodians of Targa to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are 3 large Custodian models and 2 Targa Pylon models. This set also includes the large Enemy Record Sheet for the Custodians and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.
196942.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Custodians of Targa with Targa Pylons Enemy Pack

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196943.name: Gear Miner
196943.description:
User Summary

Working in a gem mine is tough. It is about to get even tougher though. Your mine is starting to flood with acid. Jump between the gears to get out. Don't forget to grab as many jewels as you can on your way out.

196944.name: Marshmallow Fight!
196944.description:
A game where you do stunts with Marshmallows to earn points. Earn 10 points and win the game! (There is one alternative win condition)

Players take turns revealing cards from a deck of 36. Each card challenges players with various stunts. Catch one in your mouth, build a pyramid, or zing one at a buddy's forehead!

Yes, there is a card that calls for everyone to throw marshmallows at each other with reckless abandon!

This game does require marshmallows purchased at your friendly grocer and one household item, a coffee cup or similar item.

196945.name: Dexter's Laboratory: Chess Challenge

videogameversion.306418: North American Game boy Advance edition

196945.description:
The player uses one of four chess sets (Dexter's, Dee Dee's, Mandark's, or Major Glory's) featuring Dexter's Laboratory-themed pieces in the traditional game of chess. Piece captures are accompanied by animated scenes depicting the defeat of the captured piece. There is also a puzzle mode, which when completed unlocks the hardest game difficulty.
A versus mode allows two players to swap a single Game Boy Advance back and forth or play against each other on two separate Game Boy Advances with two copies of the game. The game's difficulty is geared towards younger players.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dexter%27s_Laboratory%3A_Chess_Challenge Dexter's Laboratory: Chess Challenge]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

196946.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Scafford Gang is the most ruthless band of Mutant Outlaws in the Southwest! Their leader, Colonel Scafford, was a veteran of the Confederacy during the American Civil War, who turned to crime after the South fell. Fleeing West, he started a gang of ex-Confederates, thugs, and criminals, as well as his five sons. Making their hideouts up in the caves and mines around Brimstone, they have grown hideously mutated by the corrupting influence of the Dark Stone and the Void energies that pour out of every gateway opened to another world.

The Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add the nefarious Scafford Gang and their dastardly leader, Colonel Scafford, to your games of Shadows of Brimstone!

Included are 6 Scafford Gang models and 1 Colonel Scafford model to lead them into battle, the 2 large Enemy Record Sheets for them, a host of new cards themed around these ruthless Mutants — including all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games, and 2 new Missions focusing on these deadly new Enemies!

CONTENTS
1x rulebook with 2 new missions and painting guide
1x Colonel Scafford
6x Scafford Gang
2x large enemy record sheet
1x die-cut counter sheet
38x game cards:

13x threat cards
5x scafford lieutenant cards
5x mine encounter cards
6x gear cards
8x hideous mutation cards
1x shootout card
196946.name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack

boardgameaccessory.213569: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Special Enemy Sgt. Bunker

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196947.description:
Outlaws are a common occurrence through the region around the ruins of Brimstone. Even before the town blew and the portals began to open, the gold rush and Dark Stone rush that grew the town out of control also lured in Outlaws and bandits by the thousands. Once the devastation occurred and the Darkness came, countless numbers of those Outlaws fell into shadow. Some became Mutants, other fell to the curse of the Lycan or began dabbling into dark Magiks, and many more began to rise from the grave as Undead. It wasn't long before the Undead Outlaws fell back into their old ways of robbing, rustling, and mayhem. Perhaps it was just faint memories of their old lives seeping back in, or maybe they have a cold purpose, with a mind for revenge on the land of the living.

The most famous of all is a dark, rotting figure known only as The Undead Gunslinger. Whoever he was in life, no one can say for sure. But in death, he has become the most cold killer in the land, earning the nickname of the 'Fastest Dead in the West'. He travels the roads and shadows, challenging any who cross his path to a duel. Few survive to tell the tale. Feared for his quick draw, his cold silence, and his sinister stare, The Undead Gunslinger is an unstoppable force, back from hell and hungry for revenge!

Shadows of Brimstone: Undead Gunslinger and Undead Outlaws Deluxe Enemy Set contains everything you need to add sinister Undead Outlaws and the legendary Undead Gunslinger to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! Included are 6 Undead Outlaw models and 1 Undead Gunslinger model, the 2 large Enemy Record Sheets for them, a host of new cards themed around these ghastly outlaws that have come back from the grave for revenge - including all the the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games, and 2 new Missions focusing on these deadly new Enemies!
196947.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Undead Outlaws Deluxe Enemy Pack

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196948.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops III – Awakening

videogameexpansion.176207: Call of Duty: Black Ops III

196948.description:
Awakening includes four new multiplayer maps Rise, Splash, Gauntlet and the other being a remake of the fan-favorite map Hijacked from Call of Duty: Black Ops II. Awakening also includes a brand new Zombies map called Der Eisendrache, which takes place at the Hohenwerfen Castle (named Griffin Castle in-game) in Austria, and four new Mega GobbleGums.

Source: The Developer Website.

196949.name: Beach Dunes
196949.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 296th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features some partially overgrown, seaside dunes.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

196950.name: Q*bert: Rebooted: The XBOX One @!#?@! Edition
196950.description:
One of the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful arcade games of the 1980s is back in its Classic pixel perfect 2D form, and a re-imagined Rebooted version with state of the art 3D game-play and graphics that remain faithful to the original concept.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196951.name: Earth Elemental
196951.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

In this installment, get the earth elemental as a playable class - a 16-level class that allows you to play as an earth elemental from level 1 and grow into the full power of the mighty creature!
This book includes the earth elemental monster class together with the associated feats necessary to build a solid earth elemental. Enjoy!

196952.name: Tabletopia
196952.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

With Tabletopia, you can play popular board games online with your friends or with thousands of players around the world.

196953.name: Battle Yahtzee: Alien vs. Predator
196953.description:
From the game box:

It's all out war in Alien vs. Predator BATTLE YAHTZEE where players assume the role of Predator, Alien, Marine or Scientist and attack their enemies with classic dice roll combinations like Full House and Large Straight.

Each turn you must choose to attack an enemy, regain health, or take a chance to attack everyone, in this epic battle for humanity.

196954.description:
Banished eons ago, the Last of the Shadow Kings, Beli'al, was imprisoned for his treachery in the fiery hellscape of the Caverns of Cynder! Above all else, he seeks to break his chains and escape his eternal prison. Sitting atop his magma throne, Beli'al feeds on the souls of the damned to gain strength...strength that will one day allow him to rise once more and reclaim his apocalyptic reign!

The magical bindins placed on Beli'al by the Ancients prevent him from taking physical form, but over the ages, he has regained enough power to break ff shards of his evil and fashion them into Shades of his former glory or even powerful Avatars of Darkness to do his bidding! He sends these shards of evil through portals that have been torn open into other worlds, searching for a way to break the seals that bind him. Day by day, his power grows...It is close now...Soooo Cloooose...soon the world will tremble once more before his wrath! For a new age is coming! An age of shadow and fear! The Scourge of WOrlds, Lord of Cynder, Last of the Shadow Kings, Beli'al will have his revenge!

Shadows of Brimstone: Beli'al, Last of the Shadow Kings XXL Enemy, a Deluxe Enemy Pack, contains everything you need to add epic confrontations with the Legendary Lord of Cynder, Beli'al to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! Included are 1 massive, multi-part Beli'al model, the extra large Enemy Record Sheet for him, a host of new cards themed around his ancient darkness - including a deck of Shadow Magik and all of the Threat Cards needed to add him to your games, as well as 2 new Missions for pitting your Heroes against this ultimate evil!
196954.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Beli'al, Last of the Shadow Kings XXL Enemy

146791.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

196956.name: More Forgotten Feats
196956.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside are 42 simple feats to add to your list of character options! In addition, there are 6 illustrations depicting them in action!

Here are few examples:

Improved Eschew Materials lets you cast even more spells without needing material components!
Racial Paragon gives you alternate racial traits!
Raging Heritage gives you access to bloodrager bloodline powers!
Two Weapon Strike lets you attack with two weapons as a standard action!
Wealthy gives you a sum of money each time you level up!

196957.name: Bosco's Spell Compendium: Cantrips and Orisons
196957.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flaming Crab Games, erm, "proudly" introduces the first tome in the Bosco's Spell Compendium series. Here, the bizarre wizard Bosco creates variants of classic 0-level spells:

Acid Stache (Acid Splash)
Berate Water (Create Water)
Disrupt Dead (Disrupt Undead)
Fillet of Frost (Ray of Frost)
Financed Diplomacy (Enhanced Diplomacy)
Most Sound (Ghost Sound)
No Direction (Know Direction)
Open Clothes (Open/Close)
Prancing Lights (Dancing Lights)
Respect Magic (Detect Magic)
Stable Eyes (Stabilize)
Stage Hand (Mage Hand)
Suspect Poison (Detect Poison)
Unwitting Good Guy (Unwitting Ally)
And one more! Wow!

196958.name: Once Upon an Encounter: Red Riding Hood

rpgseries.36489: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016

196958.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by classic fairy tales, the Once Upon an Encounter series gives gamemasters quick encounters that can be inserted into any adventure or campaign. Red Riding Hood is designed for a party of adventurers of levels 4-6.

A shapeshifting, demonic Wolf stalks the forest, eating hunters, foresters, and other villagers who venture into the woods.
Red Hood, a tainted paladin hunts the wolf but is sucumbing the the evil inside of her.
Will the party slay the Wolf and free both paladin and village? Or will the paladin give into the evil inside and force the party to kill her?

196959.name: The Renegades of Orion 2.0
196959.description:
User Summary

In another dimension called the astral plane, began a great battle. The battle was between Forces of Light against Renegades of Orion.

196960.name: Wheel of the Year
196960.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wheel of the Year features 9 pagan holidays, from Yule to Samhain!

For each holiday we have a brief description, the types of deities that are revered, mystic resonances (each holiday has a school of magic that's enhanced and one that's weakened), and a specific ritual/spell that may be cast during these events. Without celebrations, a campaign world is a sterile place. Breathe some life into your game with holidays!

196961.name: Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty!
196961.description:
In Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty, the player controls a Mudokon named Abe. Similar to the original, the gameplay is a sidescrolling platformer with an emphasis on puzzle solving, with New 'n' Tasty reimagined in a 2.5D graphical style.

Source: Wikipedia, "Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

196962.name: Wanderjahr
196962.description:
User Summary

This universe, this reality, there’s a source code behind all of it.

196963.name: Haunted Places
196963.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Haunted Places, you’ll find four haunts (one is sometimes also a loci), one new medium spirit, and three new archetypes inspired by those haunts just in time for the spookiest day of the year.

196964.name: Culinary Magic
196964.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Culinary Magic you’ll find rules for culinary magic, a variety of recipes, new items, feats, and traits for magical bakers and chefs, and two new archetypes: the kitchen witch and the performing chef.

196965.name: Iconic Princesses
196965.description:
From publisher blurb:

Iconic Princesses features 4 women from classic fairy tales ready to be introduced into your campaign as NPCs or even as PCs.

Each "princess" is detailed in the established iconic format (1st, 7th, and 12th level) along with a unique magic item, feat, or spell.

Inside you'll find:

Beauty. A vengeful witch that protects the powerless and curses their oppressors.
Mulan. A resourceful brawler that defends her homeland in her father's stead.
Rapunzel. A disciplined monk with a hardened mind and barbed hair.
Snow White. A wandering occultist with a zest for battle.

196966.name: Her Story
196966.description:
From publisher blurb:

In honor of Women's History Month, Her Story tells the tales of 8 incredible women (from Earth). It also features "crunch" inspired by each woman. (For example, Saint Clare Assisi inspired a pious Inquisitor archetype and 5 new virtues.)

Inside you'll find:

Countess Elizabeth Báthory de Ecsed
Queen Boudicca
Saint Clare of Assisi
Doctor Marie Curie
Hatshepsut
Joan of Arc
Osh-Tisch
Mary Shelley

196967.name: Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams – Director's Cut
196967.description:
User Summary

Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams - Director's Cut includes the follow changes from Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams:

Includes all levels from Twisted Dreams and Twisted Dreams - Rise of the Owlverlord
Bonus Halloween & Christmas themed levels
Tighter controls especially in floating areas
New lower difficulty option

196968.name: Elfhunt
196968.description:
A Jungle Adventure

From the introduction:

In the Jungles of Chult lies Camp Highmore, a trading place in the heart of the wilderness. Here the fittest rule, but an elf has recently tipped the scale of power by stealing secret military information. A group of adventurers are hired to track her down and bring her back to Camp Highmore.

A 14-28 hour adventure for 5th level characters

196969.name: My Nintendo Picross - The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess
196969.description:
This is a My Nintendo-exclusive downloadable game for Nintendo 3DS systems. In this puzzle game, you'll use numbers on a grid as clues to complete a hidden illustration with The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess theme. You can play all 45 puzzles in Picross mode or Mega Picross mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196970.name: Leomund's Misplaced Manor
196970.description:
From the introduction:

Leomund's Misplaced Manor is a D&D 5th Edition adventure designed for use in any campaign. This standalone adventure can be inserted at any point in a campaign when you wish to reward the player characters with a permanent base of operations. Finding the Deed to the Manor can be an adventure or reward in its own right and the events in Leomund's Misplaced Manor can lead to still more adventures.

Sessions: 1-2; Players: 4-5; Character Level: 5-7

196971.name: Falling Off the Dragon: A Sidetrek
196971.description:
From the introduction:

So your players are still a little on the green side. They’ve heard about Dungeons & Dragons, and have never fully understood the power and nature, and frankly the pure danger of meeting up with a real dragon. They are untrained, a little on the reckless side, and determined to seek out a dragon’s treasure before they are ready for it. I say give it to them, and get prepared for the players to do a lot of yelling "Run away!" Sometimes players need to know that the world they live in isn’t a balanced place, and that there are dangers around the corner that could turn their characters into a fried pie. Falling off the Dragon does just that. With the rumor of a nearby Dragon hoard right from the earliest levels you can quickly establish that you have a dangerous world to contend with.

Enough adventure for an evening or two for 1st-2nd level characters

196972.name: Hex Mechs
196972.description:
In the year 2523, a large wormhole opened up on the outer limits of Jupiter’s orbit. E-CON’s Navy stationed on Jupiter’s moon Titan were the first to witness as the vast Insectron horde spewed out of the rift torn upon in the Solar System. Battle across various worlds in this futuristic turn-based strategy game. Utilise a vast array of units to defeat your foes while minimising losses. Mission are varied and challenging and include objectives such as capturing an objective, defending a base and, of course, annihilating the enemy!

Key Game Features:
6 Mission Tutorial.
4 Mission ‘Earth’ Campaign.
8 Mission ‘Convex’ Campaign.
3 Factions – Earth, Martians (Humans) and Aliens.
Three classes of unit quality – Normal, Skilled and Expert.
Three Difficulty Levels – Casual, Standard and Hard.
Unit Production Buildings.
Detailed Combat Analysis.
Map zoom.
Flank Attacks.
Strategic Movement.
Game Centre Achievements and Leaderboards.
iCloud Saves.
About the Factions: Earth: Earth Coalition of Nations (E-CON) The last of human society on Earth after the Insectron Horde separated Earth from its colonies and devastated the population on Earth. The last bastion of hope for Earth, E-CON operates out of vast militarised caverns and tries it’s utmost to find a way to wrestle control of Earth back from the Insectron invaders. Aliens: Insectron The basis for all Insectron ‘life’ are two substances believed to be based on highly advanced nanomachines. The first substance, labelled ‘Xenoaqua’, is a quicksilver like substance which hardens to create Insectron structures and armour. It is highly adaptable and will self-repair by absorbing more liquid Xenoaqua. The second substance is ‘Xenophy’, a purple liquid, said to have the consistency of thick syrup. Xenophy is thought to be the ‘brains’ inside the Insectron machines and the most vulnerable to damage. It is unknown if the Insectron think with a’ hivemind’ or if they feel individuality, but both there is evidence to support both claims. The Insectrons follow a pack mentality to the point they seem to share their perceptions on the battlefield almost instantaneously, they also display fear and self-survival when in danger. Martians: The Holy Gravidus Republic (HGR) Humans first settled on Mars midway into the 22nd century. Isolated for hundreds of years, the Colony on Mars grew into a religious order. While Earth burned for decades, the Insectron horde sent a much smaller force to occupy Mars; and while the Martians and Insectrons clashed, the Martian people were left relatively unhindered in their progress. Waiting for the perfect moment, the HTR have unleashed the full potential of their technology, wiping aside the Insectron occupation force. They now have their eyes set upon Earth, to reap revenge.

Source: The Publisher Website.

196973.name: Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows
196973.description:
From the introduction:

Fishing for Gods in Strade’s Gallows is a Dungeons and Dragons 5E module designed for 3-5 players at levels 2-3. This module features NPC dynamics where cordial manners and a polite smile matter just as much as sword-swinging prowess. Original monster entries and dungeon maps can be found in the appendices.

196974.name: Fox's Gambit
196974.description:
Old Friends, New Enemies

From the introduction:

An inn-keeper’s old associate returns looking to collect on a debt. Instead he ends up drawing his friend and a hapless party into a den of intrigue involving a shadowy organization.

A 2-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters

196975.name: Identity Crisis
196975.description:
Old Friends, New Enemies

From the introduction:

In the city of Calimport, nothing is ever as it seems. A Mad Wizard's Convention returns as is yearly tradition. Coinciding with the Mad Wizard's Convention are elections for the 16 wards of Calimport. An up-and-coming politician gives his rival a bauble acquired from the Mad Wizard's Convention. Will it pave his way to newfound political power? Or will it cause an Identity Crisis?

A 2-4 hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters

196976.name: Lightning Dice
196976.description:
This is a fast and furious game of competitive dice rolling. ALL players are rolling ALL the time until a victor finally emerges!

Lighting Dice is a game that is simple, quick, and everyone plays every turn. It takes a combination of luck and skill to win but mostly it takes a quick eye and fast reflexes.

The winner is the first player to reach 20 points by matching the required numbers of the faceup goal card. Each player is assigned a player number (player 1, player 2, etc), chooses a color and takes the matching dice and pawn of that color. All the goal cards are shuffled and placed to the side. Everyone places their pawn on the start of the score track, and now you are now ready to play Lightning Dice!

196977.name: Journey on the Long Road
196977.description:
From the introduction:

With winter fast approaching, the dwarves of Citadel Hoarfrost make their way back to their mountain home, ending their trading season. On the Long Road, one such party of young dwarves makes the return journey from Damara through the Giantspire Mountains, but the late season weather threatens to grind their progress to a halt. Will they reach Citadel Hoarfrost before the winter snow flies, or will other matters keep them from their home?

A 2-hour adventure for five 2nd level dwarven characters

196978.name: Journey to the Buried Vale
196978.description:
From the introduction:

With the snows of winter receding, the scouts of Citadel Hoarfrost have spotted an unexplored cave nearby in the Buried Vale. As their first assignment, a group of young dwarven adventurers has been selected to journey to the vale and delve the recent discovery. But is their assignment all that it seems, and what dangers await them in the Buried Vale?

A 2-hour adventure for five 1st level dwarven characters

196979.name: Journey to the Summer City
196979.description:
From the introduction:

The cool days of spring have given way to the warmth of summer, bringing the dwarves of Citadel Hoarfrost forth from their mountain home to buy and sell goods throughout the surrounding lands. On the Cold Road, one such party of young dwarves makes their way toward the summer city of Bildoobaris with a wagon of glacial mead for trade. It is a simple enough task, but sometimes it's the simple tasks that cause the most problems.

A 2-hour adventure for five 2nd level dwarven characters

196980.name: Ottonian Empire: The Struggle of Medieval Dynasties 900-1050 A. D.
196980.description:
Ottonian Empire is a card based board game for 2 – 5 players, ages 13+, set in the 10th century.

Players re-live the dynastic struggles which brought into being the Holy Roman Empire from the dying embers of the Carolingian Empire. The game includes a map, 250+ cards, 6 dice, score pad, 200+ punch out counters, play money & rule book.

The games includes 2 Decks of Cards: the Imperium Deck and the Title Deck. The Imperium Deck contains the most famous nobility of the Ottonian Age (900-1050 A. D.), with their personal characteristics, and a collection of strategic cards, which the players use to build up their Dynastic Faction, acquire offices and titles and vie to become Holy Roman Emperor. The Title Deck includes the most notable titles of Nobility and Ecclesiastical Offices of that age and a description of the possessions of their domains.

The map features the political divisions of 1oth Century, Central Europe, with the Kingdoms, Duchies, Margraviates and Counties that existed in the Ottonian epoch.

The player who has accumulated the most points wins the game. The cards are used to gain victory points.

196981.name: Kobold and the Beautiful: A Sidetrek
196981.description:
From the introduction:

Look out! Kobolds! Wait a minute... what’s that sound? Is it singing? Quick nail down the fighter! Dang it! The cleric is running for the hills! Harpy! Harpy! Throw this adventure in as a way for lower level characters to take a bypass around a much more challenging creature, or as a a way to connect two levels together.

Enough adventure for an evening or two for 1st-2nd level characters

196982.name: Show Me the Way to Go Gnome: A Sidetrek
196982.description:
From the introduction:

Surprise your players with unexpected attacks. Gnomes, who are generally friendly are starting to attack. Why are local gnomes on the offensive? What is that strange light in their eyes? Did that one just hit me? What’s going on? Drop this side trek into your current dungeon crawl on a night when your players are least expecting it, or when they’ve gone around the wrong corner, and you aren’t ready for them to go that direction yet.

Enough adventure for an evening or two for 1st-2nd level characters

196983.name: Platinum Demo - Final Fantasy XV
196983.description:
PLATINUM DEMO - FINAL FANTASY XV is a free standalone game introducing players to basic systems of Final Fantasy XV, such as exploration, simple combat, and driving. The surreal story is set inside the dreams of Noctis, the main character of FFXV.

A creature named Carbuncle acts as a guide for the player and becomes available for the main game upon completion of Platinum Demo.

User Summary

196984.name: Oddities & Odysseys: The Dread Tailor
196984.description:
From the introduction:

A new threat preys on the local trade road. Rumored to have ties to the legendary undead wizards, Vecna and Acererak, Geoff the Dread Tailor has awakened to garner his revenge on the living. A group of stalwart heroes must arise to put an end to the Dread Tailor’s deprivations or all will be lost.

User summary:

An adventure for 1st-2nd level characters

196985.name: Peril on the Spine: The Red Halls
196985.description:
From the introduction:

A curse has befallen a remote farming town along the Spine of the World. A forgotten Dwarven Clan Hall has been reopened. Can you root out the source of the curse and free the town before
it’s too late?

A 2-hour adventure for 1st level characters

196986.name: Oasis of the Ants
196986.description:
Introducing Giant Ants

From the introduction:

The caravans are late and no one has heard from Pugizmal’s oasis waystation in days. Can the adventurers dig into the problem and exterminate the threat?

Giant ants are a staple both in fantasy literature and D&D. This module introduces them for 5th edition with a short side quest.

A side adventure for 2nd-3rd level characters

User summary:

This product typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing two version of the adventure - a standard PDF and a printer-friendly PDF (varying only in page background and other minor formatting, both 16 pages). Also included is a nested ZIP archive containing eight color JPG maps which can be used as print-and-play components.

196987.name: Tales from Undermountain: Remember the Fallen
196987.description:
From the introduction:

Many dream of becoming heroes and adventurers. But more often than not, these dreams end in disaster. In Undermountain there are no winners or losers, only survivors and the dead.

A 2-hour adventure for 1st - 4th level characters

User summary:

Note typographical error on the graphic cover title; this is not repeated in the body of the module.

196988.name: Small Favors Part I: Technical Difficulties
196988.description:
From the introduction:

As members of the not-quite-prestigious band of traveling players led by semi-illustrious gnomish showman J. R. Ironshoe, you've seen all the wonders and mysteries the slums of the Forgotten Realms have to offer. Now a strange incident on the road threatens to draw you deep into a mystery that will put the small and tall alike in way over their heads.

A 4-6 hour adventure for 1st - 2nd level characters

User summary:

The title may be misleading; there apparently is not another part to the adventure (at least not yet).

196989.name: Southcrypt Falls
196989.description:
A Sword Mountains Adventure

From the introduction:

This is the second module in a series that follows up on furthering the adventure from the starter set Lost Mines of Phandelver. This module contains two mini locations fit for exploration and brings characters further towards the climax brewing in the Sword Mountains. The first is a rescue mission of a noble from Waterdeep who has been captured while on adventure. The other is the threat from a chimera and her kobold horde. The region of Kryptgarden Forest and the Sword Mountains lies north of Waterdeep and south of Neverwinter along the Sword Coast. This is a stand alone adventure that can be easily modified to change location in order to suit your campaign. It also includes a few new monsters modified from previous editions, including the attack drake and kobold wyrmpriest.

A 3-night adventure for 5th-6th level characters

196990.name: Southcrypt Pass
196990.description:
A Sword Mountains Adventure

From the introduction:

Following the events in the introductory module Lost Mines of Phandelver, the characters are asked to investigate rumors of goblins gathering powerful allies.
